work: Epistle to the Son of the Wolf
author: Baha'u'llah
source_text: * حال در اين کلمات که عرف ياس از ان متضوّع تفکّر نمائيد فی مناجاته مع الاحزان الی اللّه ربّ العالمين قوله [ سبحانک اللّهمّ فاشهد بانّي بذلک الکتاب قد اخذت عهد ولاية من تظهرنّه عن کلّ شیء قبل عهد ولايتی و کفی بک و بمن آمن بآياتک عَلَیَّ شهداء و انّک انت حسبی عليک توکّلت و انّک کنت علی کلّ شیء حسيبا ] *
translation: And now, meditate upon these words, which diffuse the breath of despair, in His sorrowful invocation unto God, the Lord of the worlds. He saith: "Glorified art Thou, O My God! Bear Thou witness that, through this Book, I have covenanted with all created things concerning the Mission of Him Whom Thou shalt make manifest, ere the covenant concerning Mine own Mission had been established. Sufficient witness art Thou and they that have believed in Thy signs. Thou, verily, sufficest Me. In Thee have I placed My trust, and Thou, verily, taketh count of all things."
